III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor stated comment to "fuck" Youth A's mother and that he
would be raped if he went back to his old placement. Staff told
Youth his mother should have swallowed.
Investigation Interviews:
*The following interviews were conducted on 9/22/25 at the
facility.
Youth A reported he was outside playing basketball with his unit
when he got upset. He began to escalate verbally. Due to this
Youth A reported he went inside the unit with Supervisor and Staff
1. Youth A reported the rest of the unit stayed outside. Once
inside, Youth A reported Supervisor asked him if Youth A wanted
Supervisor to call his mother. Supervisor had stated he would call
her and let her know what Youth A was up to. Youth A reported he
told Supervisor to stop messing with him and that he couldn’t get a
hold of his mother. Supervisor then stated that “I am 5’3”, have
dreads and I am gonna dicking shit down.” Youth A reported this
meant Supervisor could have sex with his mom. Youth A reported
he told Supervisor to stop messing with him again. Youth A
reported he was upset but didn’t use profanity or get upset.
Supervisor stated “I’ll call niggers to restrain you.” Youth A
reported Supervisor called a previous (unknown) youth from his
phone and face timed him. Supervisor stated to the youth on the
phone, “this lil nigger, 14 year old, think he can fuck with me.”
Supervisor turned the phone around so Youth A was seen on the
phone and Youth A could see the youth on the phone. Youth A
reported the youth on the phone stated, “upper torso his ass.”
Youth A reported this meant to physically assault Youth A. Youth
A reported Supervisor then hung up the phone. Supervisor left the
room. After Supervisor left, Staff 2 came into the unit and
Supervisor followed her. Youth A reported they started their group
for the evening and when he spoke up, Supervisor told him to
“shut-up.” Youth A reported somehow the conversation shifted
and Supervisor reported if Youth A was at a different facility,
Youth A would get beat up and raped for the way he was
behaving. Supervisor asked Staff 2 if she agreed to this and she
told Supervisor to stop talking to Youth A. Youth A reported he
said to Staff 2, “You’re dicksucking me.” Youth A reported Staff 2
2

responded, “You’re dicksucking me and your mom should have
swallowed you.” Youth A reported this meant Staff 2 was saying
Youth A was too focused on her and that his mother should have
not had sex, but swallowed semen so Youth A would not have
been born. Youth A reported the other youth in the room were
shaking their head and quiet.
Staff 3 reported she was not there for the incident in question but
heard from Youth A about the incident. Staff 3 reported she heard
from other youth that Supervisor uses profanity and can be
disrespectful. Staff 3 reported she has never seen this though.
Staff 1 reported he was in the unit with Supervisor and Youth A.
Staff 1 reported it was just the three of them in the unit. Staff 1
reported Supervisor told Youth A he could call Youth A’s mother.
Staff 1 confirmed Supervisor stated “I am 5’3”, have dreads and I
am gonna dicking shit down.” Staff 1 felt Supervisor and Youth A
might have known each other from the community based on the
way they were talking to each other. Staff 1 confirmed Supervisor
facetimed a youth on his phone. Staff 1 did not know who it was
but confirmed Youth A and the unknown youth saw each other on
the phone. Staff 1 confirmed Supervisor stated to the unknown
youth on the phone, “This 14-year-old nigger wants to fuck with
me.” Staff 1 reported he did not know what was stated from the
unknown youth. Staff 1 reported this was the first time he ever
heard Supervisor talk this way. Staff 1 confirmed Supervisor
stated the comment concerning being beaten up and raped if in
the “old program.” Staff 1 reported later in the evening Staff 2 and
the other youth came into the unit for group meeting. At that time,
Staff 1 reported Youth A stated, “You all dicksucking me” and
stated Staff 2 responded with “Your mama should have
swallowed.” Staff 1 reported he told Staff 2 to “tap out” meaning to
leave the room. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 stopped talking after that.
Staff 1 reported after the incident he talked to Supervisor about
what happened. Staff 1 reported he told Supervisor the situation
should not have gone the way it did and discussed that others will
follow him. Staff 1 reported Supervisor appeared receptive. Staff 1
reported the other youth in the room didn’t say anything and Youth
A appeared to be “playing it off” to possibly save face in front of
the other youth in the room.
Youth B reported he was present during the incident at group
time. Youth B reported Youth A and Supervisor were arguing.
Youth B reported Supervisor used profanity and stated the word
“nigger” in the conversation. Youth B reported Supervisor asked
out loud if Youth A would get raped in another facility. Youth B
3

reported no one answered this. Youth B reported when Youth A
said, “You are dicksucking me,” Staff 2 responded with “No, you
are dicksucking me.” Youth B denied Staff 2 stating a comment
about Youth A’s mom should have swallowed. Youth B reported
that was all he heard.
Youth C reported he was in the group room when Youth A and
Supervisor were talking. Youth C denied Supervisor being
inappropriate, using profanity, name calling, or using the word
“nigger.” Youth C reported Supervisor will tell youth assertively
what youth need to hear. Youth C reported it might come across
harsh sometimes but its professional. Youth C reported youth
don’t always want to hear it, but he is helping. Youth C reported
he didn’t hear Staff 2 say anything inappropriate.
*The following interviews were conducted at the facility on
10/16/25:
Supervisor reported he took Youth A into the unit after Youth A
had been verbally escalated while playing basketball. Supervisor
reported he was in the unit with Youth A and Staff 1. Supervisor
reported he told Youth A that he could call his mother so Youth A
could talk to her. Supervisor reported Youth A did not want to call
his mother and called her a “bitch.” Supervisor denied stating he
could have sex with his mother and denied describing himself as
5”3 and with dreads. Supervisor denied using the phone and
denied facetiming a youth. Supervisor denied showing his phone
to Youth A. Supervisor reported he has never used profanity with
the youth. Supervisor reported he was not a part of the group
later. Supervisor reported he was in his office in the unit when
they had group and came out once to redirect. Supervisor
reported Youth A stated, “Y’all dicksucking me” and he redirected
that comment. Supervisor reported he asked Staff 2 if this
behavior would be okay at other facilities that she has worked at.
Supervisor reported Staff 2 said “no” and that this behavior is not
acceptable anywhere. Supervisor reported no one mentioned
being raped or beat up if Youth A was at another facility.
Staff 2 reported she was outside with the unit at the basketball
courts when Youth A got upset. Because of this, Supervisor and
Staff 1 took him inside the unit while she stayed outside. Later she
came into the unit. Group was then run, and Youth A was being
disrespectful and using profanity. Staff 2 reported she redirected
his behavior and let him know that his behavior would result in
loss of privileges. Staff 2 reported he called her a “dicksucking
bitch.” Staff 2 reported she did not say anything back. Staff 2
4

denied Supervisor using profanity during the conversation and
reported he spoke in general terms that the behaviors Youth A
were exhibiting would not be acceptable anywhere he went. Staff
2 denied anyone talking about being raped or beat up if they acted
the way Youth A was acting. Staff 2 reported Supervisor gave
advice to Youth A, but it was never inappropriate. Staff 2 denied
stating “Your mother should have swallowed.” Staff 2 reported
Youth A has stated that he was going to get Supervisor and
herself fired.
Video Reviewed:
Video was reviewed for 9/16/25 at 4pm. The video lasted 1 minute
and 51 seconds. Youth A, Staff 1, and Supervisor are in the unit.
Youth A and Staff 1 are sitting down in chairs while Supervisor is
standing up near them. Supervisor has his phone out and is video
calling an unknown individual. He shows Staff 1 and then is seen
talking to the individual on the phone.
Documentation:
• Supervisor personnel file was reviewed:
o Supervisor does not have discipline in his file.
o Supervisor’s central registry was completed on
4/28/25.
o Supervisor completed training on Policy and
Procedures on 6/25/25.
• Staff 2’s personnel file was reviewed:
o Staff 2 does not have discipline in her file.
o Staff 2’s central registry was completed on 4/28/25.
o Staff 2 completed training on Policies and
Procedures on 6/25/25.
• I reviewed the Prohibited Behavioral Interventions policy:
The following interventions are strictly prohibited…verbal
abuse, threats…any form of name calling, yelling,
humiliation, use of derogatory or discriminatory language,
or threats by staff is not permitted.
• There was no incident report for the conversations that
occurred in the unit.
Analysis The agency is found non-compliant with this rule. Staff 1, Youth A,
and Youth B all reported Supervisor used profanity and derogatory
language. Staff 3 had not witnessed the incident but has stated
that youth have told her that Supervisor does use profanity and
can be disrespectful. Staff 1, who was in the room with
Supervisor, confirmed not only the profanity and derogatory
language but also statements of humiliation concerning Youth A’s
mother. Staff 1, Youth A, Youth B all reported Staff 2 stated
5

derogatory remarks. Although the extent of Staff 2’s usage varied
amongst them there is evidence to validate Staff 2’s involvement.
Technical Assistance:
Staff 1 was present when Supervisor and Staff 2 used profanity
and derogatory language with Youth A. Staff 1 did not report this
information to a supervisor. It is the responsibility of all staff to
provide for the continual needs and protection and supervision of
youth. By not reporting this to a supervisor, staff are unable to be
properly trained or corrected to conform to the milieu of the
agency. The agency will need to address this area of concern
within the corrective action plan.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & R 400.4130 Privacy and Confidentiality
Section (1) An institution shall assure resident and parent privacy and
Description confidentiality and shall protect residents from exploitation.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor video called an unknown youth with his personal
phone, disclosing Youth A’s identity to an unknown youth and
discussing Youth A.
Investigation Interviews:
*The following interviews were conducted on 9/22/25 at the
facility.
Youth A reported Supervisor called a previous (unknown) youth
from his phone and face timed him. Supervisor stated to the youth
on the phone, “this lil nigger, 14 year old, think he can fuck with
me.” Supervisor turned the phone around so Youth A was seen on
the phone and Youth A could see the youth on the phone. Youth A
reported the youth on the phone stated, “upper torso his ass.”
Youth A reported this meant to physically assault Youth A. Youth
A reported Supervisor then hung up the phone.
Staff 1 confirmed Supervisor facetimed a youth on his phone.
Staff 1 did not know who it was but confirmed Youth A and the
unknown youth saw each other on the phone. Staff 1 confirmed
Supervisor stated to the unknown youth on the phone, “This 14-
year-old nigger wants to fuck with me.” Staff 1 reported he did not
know what was stated from the unknown youth.
Supervisor denied using the phone and denied facetiming a
youth. Supervisor denied showing his phone to Youth A.
6

Video Reviewed:
Video was reviewed for 9/16/25 at 4pm. The video lasted 1 minute
and 51 seconds. Youth A, Staff 1, and Supervisor are in the unit.
Youth A and Staff 1 are sitting down in chairs while Supervisor is
standing up near them. Supervisor has his phone out and is video
calling an unknown individual. He shows Staff 1 and then is seen
talking to the individual on the phone.
Documentation:
• I reviewed the Privacy and Confidentiality Policy:
MYTC is committed to maintaining the privacy and
dignity of all youth in our care…parental or legal
guardian consent is required to disclose protected
information including publicly disclosing a youth’s
identity…
Analysis The agency is non-compliant with this rule. Supervisor made a
video call in the unit and an unknown youth was given access to
Youth A’s identity.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
